properties.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 8 at 2:18PM EST until January 8 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Mount Holly NJ
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a

* Snow Squall Warning for...
Northeastern Morris County in northern New Jersey...
Central Sussex County in northwestern New Jersey...

* Until 300 PM EST.

* At 218 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located over Newton,
moving east at 35 mph.

HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow.
Wind gusts greater than 40 mph.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.

* This includes Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 44
and 54.

Locations impacted include...
Newton, Hopatcong, Lincoln Park, Kinnelon, Boonton, Butler, Franklin,
Mountain Lakes, Riverdale, Hamburg, Ogdensburg, Branchville, Andover,
Lake Mohawk, Pequannock Township, Lake Telemark, Green Pond,
Pellettown, Crandon Lakes and White Meadow Lake.
properties.instruction:
Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes
your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra
time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead
to accidents.

There is no safe place on a highway when a snow squall hits.
Visibility and traction are immediately lost in whiteout conditions,
making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped
vehicles. Delay travel or safely exit the highway before the snow
squall arrives.

CMAMtext: Snow Squall Warning til 3:00 PM EST. Sudden whiteouts. Icy roads. Slow down! -NWS
